item.description: Bitcoin's future hinges less on technological factors and more on how AI affects growth, employment, real interest rates, and central bank liquidity, NYDIG Research argues.

item.title: Bitcoin is stuck in a rut but JPMorgan says new legislation could be the ultimate spark
item.description: JPMorgan said the long-awaited Clarity Act would bring regulatory clarity, boost institutional participation and accelerate tokenization across U.S. crypto markets.

item.title: Crypto treasury companies likely to consolidate in 2026: Crypto exec
item.description: Declining crypto prices mean that many digital asset treasuries are either underwater or trading at a discount to their net asset value.

item.title: Iran crisis puts the regime's $7.8 billion crypto shadow economy in spotlight
item.description: The government relies on this crypto infrastructure for international trade, while ordinary Iranians use it as a financial lifeline during protests and economic crises.

item.title: The 'stablecoin sandwich' is dead: Why the next phase of crypto payments is all about the user relationship
item.description: The real competitive advantage in stablecoins, the moat that holds competitors at bay, now lies in the distribution held by incumbents, according to the person behind Meta's abandoned Diem token.

item.title: Bitcoin Recovers Following Plunge as US, Israel Begin Bombing Iran
item.description: The price of Bitcoin plummeted to nearly $63,000 overnight amid U.S. and Israel strikes on Iran, but has mostly recovered in the hours since.

item.title: Banking Regulator Floats New Stablecoin Yield Rules‚ÄîDo They Hurt Coinbase?
item.description: The proposed rules would limit the ability of third parties to pass stablecoin rewards on to users, but experts are split on what the language could mean for America‚Äôs top crypto firms.

item.title: Crypto community fear of Iran choking oil supply and crashing markets may be overblown
item.description: A full closure of the strait is unlikely or impractical, some experts argue.

item.title: Citi and Morgan Stanley expand bitcoin and crypto custody, trading and tokenization efforts

item.title: Magic Eden Pulls Plug on Bitcoin and Ethereum Support, Doubles Down on Solana
item.description: Magic Eden is pulling support for Ethereum-compatible and Bitcoin-based assets, marking an end to its multi-chain approach to user adoption.

item.description: Trump Media is considering spinning off its Truth Social platform into its own public entity.

item.title: Ethereum Tokens Swiped, Returned After South Korean Tax Service Publishes Wallet Seed Phrases
item.description: South Korea's tax service shared the seed phrases for seized wallets in a press release. The contents were then taken, but ultimately returned.

item.title: Ban on Crypto Privacy Tools Would Be Counterproductive: UK Think Tank
item.description: UK officials at a recent roundtable by the Royal United Services Institute want to integrate compliance solutions into crypto privacy tools.

item.title: Bitcoin's rebound cancelled as U.S. stocks fall, gold surges, amid mounting macro risks
item.description: Between credit stress concerns, a hot PPI inflation reading, and tensions between U.S. and Iran, investors have plenty of reasons to stay away from risk assets.
